text: chia seeds are all the rage lately and
you've probably heard a little something
about them or seen them in smoothies and
other drinks but what you might not know
is that they're packed with antioxidants
and heart-healthy omega-3 fatty acids
and they have a really delicious mild
nutty flavor and can be used in all
kinds of dishes not just sweet but also
savory first though you have to soak
them that's important a good ratio is
1/4 cup of chia seeds to a cup of liquid
these are black chia seeds but you can
also find them white so just put them
into a jar I like to use a mason jar
that seals easily for refrigerating and
then one cup of water so 4 to 1 liquid
the chia seed and these need to soak for
at least 20 minutes if you're just
soaking them quickly you can leave them
at room temperature but I like to make
big batches and put them in the fridge
and then you can use them throughout the
week this is what they look like when
they're soaked you can see they've
swollen up and become pale and the
mixture is thick and luscious like a
pudding texture now for a parfait one of
my favorite ways to use it
I like to flavor it with almond milk and
maple syrup
you could also soak them in almond milk
not just water so for about 1/2 a cup I
like to use a few tablespoons of almond
milk stir that in and it just loosens it
up nicely just transfer that into a
serving glass mmm that almond milk
smells fantastic and then top it with
some fruit I like berries this time of
year and tropical fruits like Kiwi one
of my favorites and for the finishing
touch
maple syrup now that is an excellent
breakfast or dessert
don't you think few other things you can
do with it first smoothie this is a
mixed berry smoothie take your soap
seeds you can either spoon it on top
like this or you can stir it in and
drink it but I like it like this the
presentations nice and then a good
breakfast idea with oatmeal just stir it
right in makes the oatmeal even
healthier than it already is and it
looks pretty too so there's a few ideas
for chia seeds healthy and
happy eating
you
